page.title: 12Farming
page.content: This block is mixed farming land, renowned for its good stock rearing qualities and strong soil which will grow hops. There are 23 farms in the area with a total acreage of 2,700, some of this land lying outside the area. Three farms produce milk, seven grow hops, there is one intensive pig farm, and two farms have semi-inten- sive poultry. Three quarters of the farm land is in pasture for cattle and sheep. The rest grows hops, corn, and fruit - apples, cider apples, plums, blackcurrants, blackberries, and rasp- berries. Every farm used to grow cider apples and produce cider for their farm workers. The cattle breed has changed over the years, it was once all pure Herefords, but now most cattle are Hereford crosses or Friesians.
